dublinCore.dc:title: 119 S1608 IS: Supporting New Entrepreneurs and Workers By Undoing and Streamlining Inhibitors to Nascent Enterprises through Supporting Successful Efficiency Solutions Act
dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.

form.current-chamber: IN THE SENATE OF THE UNITED STATES
form.official-title: To require the Administrator of the Small Business Administration to provide awards to recognize State and local governments that improve the process of forming a new business, and for other purposes.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Supporting New Entrepreneurs and Workers By Undoing and Streamlining Inhibitors to Nascent Enterprises through Supporting Successful Efficiency Solutions Act or the Supporting NEW BUSINESSES Act.

section.header: Awards for streamlining the process of business formation

subsection.text: The Small Business Act (15 U.S.C. 631 et seq.) is amended—

paragraph.text: by redesignating section 49 (15 U.S.C. 631 note) as section 50; and
by inserting after section 48 (15 U.S.C. 657u) the following:

section.header: Awards for streamlining the process of business formation

subsection.text: The Administrator shall, on an annual basis, provide 3 awards to recognize State and local governments that implement innovative and effective policies or tools to streamline processes related to the formation of small business concerns in their communities, of which—

paragraph.text: 1 award shall be provided to a State or local government that represents a community of not less than 400,000 individuals;
1 award shall be provided to a State or local government that represents a community of not less than 100,000 and less than 400,000 individuals; and
1 award shall be provided to a State or local government that represents a community of less than 100,000 individuals.

subsection.text: A State or local government seeking an award under subsection (a) shall submit to the Administrator an application at such time, containing such information, and in such manner as the Administrator may require.
In providing an award under subsection (a), the Administrator shall consider whether a State or local government streamlined the process described in subsection (a) by—

paragraph.text: streamlining or reducing redundancies in paperwork, forms, or other written or online documents required to form a small business concern;
consolidating resources available to individuals looking to form a small business concern, such as through the creation of user-friendly online portals;
reducing duplication or inconsistencies in requirements between overlapping jurisdictions; or
innovatively making necessary procedures more streamlined or efficient.
